intro: Lysanthe stylosa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of white or pale pink petals. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette. Lysanthe stylosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
